column4: what's the selected default device in System> Preferences> Sound?
there's only one sound device available. Intel 82801CA
and if you select it and click Close, is sound audible again?
yeah, done that many times. rebooted many times
``asoundconf list''
asoundconf list shows 1 device
the 82801CA, correct?
correct
what audio apps don't seem to output audible volume?
pastebin ``cat /etc/asound.conf ~/.asoundrc*''
I think you might have found it
I see a string in there that was in the errors
I tried renaming my ~/.asoundrc and will try again
the proper way to set it is: ``asoundconf set-default-card $(asoundconf list|grep -v ^Names|head -1)''
I removed my ~/.asoundrc and aplay now prints a different briefer error. device is busy.
I'll try it your way :-)
``lsof /dev/dsp* /dev/snd/*''
I seems that removing my .asoundrc did the trick. It must have added the device there and never removed it
thanks so much
np
